attributes.action: Government should not allow pilots to work on Christmas day
attributes.background:
This is a petition to bring to attention pilots who fly thousands of miles away from their families on the most precious day of the year for many people! 

Help me petition government to put a ban to flying on Christmas day!
attributes.additional_details:
I am surrounded by pilots, many of whom complain about working in Christmas day. The banks shut, so why shouldn't pilots have a "pilot day"? 

I call on government to help pilots and their families spend their day together. 

If pilots are being forced to fly on Christmas day, their families should be rewarded with free flights and accommodation to enable the families to be together. 

Please call on government to make this a possibility!

attributes.action: Small business should not pay employer's NI for employees of state pension age
attributes.background: Employees or Self-Employed of state pension age do not pay NI contributions so why should Employers? I spoke to David Cameron about this and he was intending to look into it but this did not happen due to the EU referendum result

attributes.action: Negotiate a bespoke reciprocal visa agreement between the UK and the EU
attributes.background: Now the UK voted to leave the EU we will lose the freedom of movement right. This will cease once we leave and will mean we have to apply for a visa to go to the EU on holiday as we are third country nationals. The EU has plans to introduce a £50 holiday visa for citizens of third countries.
attributes.additional_details: This £50 charge is quite expensive for a holiday visa and will deter people going abroad. The only option could be a reciprocal visa agreement between the UK and the EU/EEA. This could mean that UK citizens can travel to the EU, for 180 days, for free. This however, is only possible if we allow all EU nationals coming to the UK the same agreements. We could also include reciprocal emergency healthcare in this visa agreement. This will make it easier for full single market access.

attributes.action: Put 5 pence on national Insurance contributions to fund our N.H.S.
attributes.background: Everyone can afford 5pence to save our N.HS dont sit there do something

attributes.action: Require manufacturers & suppliers to label reduction in size/volume of a product
attributes.background: Since the economic downturn in 2009, manufacturers & suppliers of food & other consumer goods such as washing liquids have been reducing the size or volume of products whilst maintaining the same selling price or increasing it. This results in the consumer paying more money for less goods.
attributes.additional_details: Often the reductions are so subtle, that a consumer is unaware that anything has changed. This practice is misleading & unfair & it is time that manufacturers & suppliers are required to clearly mark a reduction in size or volume. This practice has made the weekly shop much more expensive & by labelling the reduction in size, consumers will be better informed to look at alternative products that may offer better value for money. See examples in this Daily Mail article: https://goo.gl/0aUpQF

attributes.action: Introduce a TV License Discount for Full Time Students
attributes.background: This petition calls on the government to take advantage of the TV license freeze ending in March 2017 to introduce a reduced rate TV license for full time students living in single occupancy rooms. By introducing a reduced rate, more students would consider buying a license.
attributes.additional_details: Unlike a typical home where only one license is needed, students staying in halls of residence are required to purchase an individual license for their room. For example, if a hall has 8 rooms on it, each student is currently required to purchase their own license for just one room at full cost. This is a large amount of money and it is unfair to charge students so much more despite them being on limited budgets. By introducing a reduced rate for single rooms, more students would pay the fee.

attributes.action: Stop forcing English Standard on Young Deaf children
attributes.background: Make English more accessible for Deaf People (e.g. for us not to be forced to achieve English at C grade standard) each classes should have specialist tutor (e.g. Teacher of Deaf and being taught in small groups) Deaf people should not being stopped progressing from achieving a C grade or above
attributes.additional_details: English is our second language, as we find English so hard to understand! which is why we use Sign Language which has a different structure and no written language. We need to stop feeling like we are being forced to learn English at C grade Standard and it is important that we taught English in a way that is accessible to us.

attributes.action: Allow heating in education to be on in all colder months through more funding
attributes.background: I myself am a student of 16 with asthma. Throught my whole time in education I , along with all my peers , have suffered through the lack of heating. Simply wrapping up warm doesn't work, as breathing in cold air causes illnesses , leading to absents. Please help change this.

attributes.action: Outlaw sale of electronics with firmware reflashing code that can be reflashed
attributes.background: For security, require electronic devices with "reflashable" or other alterable firmware to have the section of code that performs the reflashing, and one that correctly downloads the current reflashable firmware contents, stored in Read Only Memory that is electronically impossible to alter.
attributes.additional_details:
Cyber attacks against hardware have begun to take the form of reflashing attacks which modify the firmware of the targeted device.

If the device's capability to be reflashed can itself be removed or tampered with by reflashing, attack code can make itself undetectable and impossible to remove, requiring the entire electronic device to be thrown away.

The proposal would obstruct this form of attack as fixed unchangable code would exist allow reflashing and reporting of flash memory contents.

attributes.action: Save Kingfisher Ward and Scbu at Dorchester County Hospital!!
attributes.background: The facilities for the care of very small babies and children are due to be cut drastically. This will involve having to travel at least an hour to get the medical care needed. This is just quite frankly ridiculous!! Time in an emergency is one of the key factors in the best chances of survival.

attributes.action: Ban weapons using nanotechnology before they are able to be produced
attributes.background: Nanotechnology could be reality in the next few years and, while there are many benefits of this, the potential of nanotech weapons is too great a threat to humanity to be allowed, these weapons must be banned before they can be produced to prevent the devistation that could arise from their use

attributes.action: Hold a general election under MMP
attributes.background: In the 2015 general election The conservative party got just 37 percent of the vote however they got a majority in the house of commons undermining the very ideas of democracy.
attributes.additional_details: The UK currently uses first pass the post which goes horribly with the UK's system of electing M.Ps creating a system which people can't vote for there preferred party and punishes those who do.MMP is a system that allows you to vote both for a local representative whilst allows you to vote for your favourable political party making it the best system for the country.if Britain claims to be a democracy it must act like one.

attributes.action: Give the HSE more powers under the law to regulate gas safety for consumers.
attributes.background: A recent Which? investigation showed that engineers failed to provide boiler servicing which is safe and meets minimum requirements for the job. Of the 6 'big companies' and 4 independent companies checked 70% failed to meet minimum legal requirements. The HSE need legal powers to be effective.
attributes.additional_details:
The Health & Safety Executive must be able to hold Gas Safe and it's engineers to account and ensure Gas Safe registered engineers:

1} are competent to complete a full, safe boiler service, with regular checks on performance

2} have a legal minimum boiler service time

3} complete a clear, detailed report

4} are held to account in the same way as other professions which potentially risk peoples lives

5} HSE should complete robust checks on standards of work & update the registration process.

attributes.action: Standardise ID requirements for all public and quasi-public bodies
attributes.background: At present any public authority (or quasi public authority such as a utility company or railway) can randomly select what ID requirements are needed from members of the public to interact with them.  Surely this could be standardised for all such institutions through very simple legislation.
attributes.additional_details: For instance some PAs (eg the Bank of England if you want to exchange old bank notes) will accept a driver's licence as proof over address, others (eg my local authority issuing a parking permit) will only accept a utility bill less than 3 months old and not if it is copied from an on-line bill.   NB this is NOT a request for introduction of compulsory ID cards.

attributes.action: Ask this Government to consider issuing a medal to all serving armed forces.
attributes.background: I consider anyone serving their country for security and safety reasons should be acknowledged by means of a medal of service for their dedication and support to make this a safer and better World for us all to live and work in as a show of appreciation.

attributes.action: Where possible, make it policy for cars used by all authorities, be British made
attributes.background: It only seems logical for cars used by the police force, or even any other public body, buy cars with the vast majority of their supply chain in Britain - as long as the car serves that particular purpose and is cost effective. Not only does it decrease a carbon footprint, it safeguards an industry.

attributes.action: Establish extradition treaties so British victims of crime are supported.
attributes.background: I want to raise the issue of the safety of British Nationals and their families overseas and develop on the international extradition treaties and assistance that is in place.
attributes.additional_details: If you or a member of your family has been subjected to a crime a suspected criminal can flee to another country or back to the UK that has no treaty in place and will not face any criminal proceedings.

attributes.action: Stop the advertising of alcohol.
attributes.background: People struggling with alcohol addiction face many daily struggles be it from withdrawals, anxiety, panic attacks. The list goes on, advertising of alcohol can often be a major trigger for someone suffering from alcohol dependencies when trying to remain abstinent.

attributes.action: Make spice a class A drug
attributes.background: We all need to come together and stop this. The nhs is under enough pressure as it. So please sign this and lets make the world a better place to live.
attributes.additional_details: I'm starting a petition about spice and illegal highs, now at one time they was legal, now they are not legal. I have noticed an increase of homeless people in Manchester City centre, smoking spice and not knowing what to do afterwards. The worst case can cause death.  Now I'm no drug expert, but these drugs should not be allowed on our streets. Especially where elderly people, kids really all types of different lifestyles & all ages are. So please help my petition come into action.

attributes.action: Make it law that you have to move out of the way for emergency services.
attributes.background: I have seen a video in germany where they all move out of the way and make a space for the emergency services to get through easier and quicker. So by law I think we should have to do this in england.

attributes.action: Include school trips within 'childcare,' allowing payment by childcare vouchers
attributes.background: Childcare vouchers save working parents up to £935 each. At present, vouchers can be used for anything deemed as 'qualifying care,' however school trips do not currently fit within that criteria. Making it easier for parents to afford these expenses will allow more children access to these trips.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst childcare - under the 2006 childcare act - excludes care given during the school hours. I argue that residential trips, domestic or international, are beyond the remit of school care so should be categorised as 'qualifying care' and eligible for payment via voucher.

attributes.action: Improve rights of cohabiting unmarried women after a relationship breakdown
attributes.background: A married woman forced to leave her husband due to domestic violence is generally entitled to 50% of the couple's assets whereas an unmarried woman is entitled to nothing other than pitiful maintenance payments for her children but nothing for herself.
attributes.additional_details: It is ridiculous that, in this day and age, just because a cohabiting couple have not gone through a 30 minute marriage ceremony, the entitlement after a split to the assets they have accumulated together is completely different than in the case of if they are married. Invariably the woman, who often will be forced to leave with her children due to her partner's behaviour, will lose out. Scotland changed its laws in 2005 to give equal protection for cohabiting women, so why can't we do the same?

attributes.action: Allow pregnant women to use staff toilets if a customer toilet is not available.
attributes.background: The increased need to go to the toilet is an unavoidable symptom of pregnancy. When out in public, this sudden urge can lead to an embarrassing rejection from staff in many shops who refuse to allow a pregnant lady to use their staff toilets forcing them to walk around in the hope of finding one.
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets, clothes shops and coffee shops have been known to not allow pregnant women access to their staff toilets when there is no customer toilet available.

attributes.action: Stop taxpayers money from being spent on translators and interpreters in the UK
attributes.background: It's nothing new that millions of pounds of taxpayers money is spent each year for migrants who don't speak English. The huge sum of money is spent in hospitals and courts among other places on translators and interpreters for migrants who come to the UK and don't speak English.

attributes.action: Reverse any law that currently bans sale and/or posession of research chemicals.
attributes.background: It should be the choice of an individual to buy, and to use research chemicals according to their own will.

attributes.action: Ban local councils from using unfair camera cars.
attributes.background: Dropping someone off at bus stop and a camera car catches you get a £55 pound fine these cars are unfair if you appeal all you get is you should not have done it.

attributes.action: Fund regular Checks for Babies and Children. Minimum of once every 3 months.
attributes.background: We are constantly seeing chases of Child abuse in the media. And the question on everyone's mind is always. How can this happen and why wasn't it noticed?. As a mother myself I know the checks made on children are rare. I petition to have checks of a minimum of once every 3 months until school age.
attributes.additional_details:
Child abuse happens so often we just need to watch the news or any social media app to see the constant flow of cases as evidence, it's far too often. 

As a mother myself I am very aware of the lack of checks mandatory for children. Some yearly checks are satisfied by a mere phone call to a parent. 

I petition all children until attending regular school/pre-school should be professionally checked physically especially, as a minimum of once every 3 months. Babies and children need protecting.

attributes.action: Make father's who have DNA test automatically on birth certificate
attributes.background: Some mothers are scared if they put the father's on birth certificates then they have less rights but no matter what for the benefit of that child both parents should be on the birth certificate and father's should still need to prove their parenting via contact centres etc
attributes.additional_details: I have seen to many devoted fathers with no rights whatsoever it isn't fair in this day and age, we all have the right to be equal and every child deserves to know who brought them into this world, this is the only flaw in our system in this situation we all have a point to prove ourselves and thats what contact centres are in place for worried parents of their ex partners for different reasons and background checks go into parents for to see who these people are

attributes.action: Please exempt students of EU nationality from the CSI requirement
attributes.background:
Please exempt students holding EU nationality from the requirement of having comprehensive sickness insurance when applying for permanent residency document.
Most of us are in their 20s, healthy, and been living in the UK most of our life. No one really knew about this requirement until recently.
attributes.additional_details:
Most of us, despite often speaking better English than our parents' language, realise that we are not eligible to residency documents because of CSI requirement only when our application gets rejected.

https://www.gov.uk/eea-registration-certificate/permanent-residence
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39014191
https://www.freemovement.org.uk/comprehensive-sickness-insurance-what-is-it-and-who-needs-it/

attributes.action: Primary & secondary school teachers should be paid a minimum of £25,000 PA
attributes.background: Teaching is crucial in getting children the best learning and teachers are not paid enough for the amount of work they do. They should be paid a minimum of £25,000 with it to raise to £30,000 a year minimum after 3 years at the same school. This will help teachers become more stable at 1 school.

attributes.action: Consider moving Britain’s Parliament to Manchester
attributes.background: As a solution to the problem of the eye watering expense of renovating The Palace of Westminster
attributes.additional_details: http://www.economist.com/blogs/bagehot/2017/02/go-north

attributes.action: Longer prison sentences for rape, murder and serious crimes.
attributes.background: A 23-year-old man was lured to a park and beaten for several hours and later died,The murderers were given 20 & 21 yrs. A man has been jailed for 12 years after he attacked a woman so badly that her face became completely detached from her skull. Given 12 yrs. NOT LONG ENOUGH!
attributes.additional_details: We keep getting told that our prisons are over crowded! they may well be, but how many of those offer no threat to the general public? let them out and get them doing work for the community and free the beds for the rapist, murders and child sex offenders that we want off our streets so it can be a safer place to bring a family up in. And then give longer sentences to these offenders and that might deter others, and they will think twice before reoffending. Then our prisons will have vacancies.

attributes.action: Align all Parliamentary Constituencies with Local Government boundaries.
attributes.background:
Benefits:

Reducing the number of MPs from the current 600 planned to approximately 400, thereby reducing cost to the taxpayer.

Creates a direct link between local and national representation.

Constituency Office funding directly related to the size of the Local Authority's Electoral Roll.
attributes.additional_details:
The current system is based on the somewhat outdated idea that each constituency contains roughly the same number of voters, supposedly creating an equality of representation.

Given that MPs only have one vote the size of their constituency is immaterial.

As we elect MPs to represent us in Parliament it is the relationship between a local MP and their constituents that is far more important than the size of the constituency.

attributes.action: Both Parents assumed Equal parental rights(50 50) unless safeguarding issue .
attributes.background: The continued removal of loving parents through the family courts when one party has less rights, I believe is putting strain on our society as its causing the parents and the children mental health issues( such as self esteem), which in the long term is having a detrimental impact on our nation.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties against Hash smoking or possession
attributes.background: I am a London resident who has to deal with hash smokers every day. These people aren't like weed smokers, they are so much worse. The hash smells so much and stinks my building up, plus the hash they're smoking is mostly rubber and mud and it does horrible things to their bodies unlike weed smoke.

attributes.action: Replace number plates with a road-tax disk like bar code
attributes.background: Many people do not like the look of number plates due to the bulky look & on many new cars, they do not seem to match aesthetically. Also, number plates can be stolen easily however with a tax-disk like sticker it is harder. It would reduce the amount of number plate thefts; assisting the police.
attributes.additional_details: For police investigation, they can read it like a number plate and it will come up on the police computer with all of the vehicles details.

attributes.action: Sugar Tax: Government to re-debate Sugar Tax and potentially scrap Sugar Tax
attributes.background: Debate to consider: undesirable side effects of artificial sweeteners (AS); aspartame approved at current levels of consumption. Levels may increase due to ST; choice to consume natural product (sugar); tax from ST to research health impact of AS and fund nutrition education
attributes.additional_details: The Sugar Tax compromises and demonizes the use of a natural substance and promotes synthesized products. Sugar has been used for centuries to sweeten food. We know the side effects of its excessive consumption. In comparison, artificial sweeteners are a new phenomenon. Not enough conclusive research has been carried out for the Government to decree that sweeteners are a healthy alternative to sugar. For example, research into aspartame concluded it is both safe and a potential source of cancer.

attributes.action: Standardise dress sizes
attributes.background: It's about time that we standardise dress sizes here in the UK. The fact that a woman could be a size 8 and a size 16 in the same shop is ridiculous.  This is 2017 and it's about time there were guidelines for suppliers to follow.
attributes.additional_details: This affects everyone from babies, woman of all ages, shapes and sizes to our young impressionable girls who already have to struggle with what the media tells them they have to look like.

attributes.action: Discontinue the practice of Prime Minister's Questions
attributes.background:
The ongoing insult to the UK citizens intelligence every Wednesday in Parliament due to the dishonesty and insult hurling which has become the norm under recent Prime Ministers. 
The establishment of  rules and disciplines are needed to allow this to become a meaningful and accountable process.

attributes.action: Ban Chewing Gum from being sold in the UK. Make towns cleaner and healthier.
attributes.background: No matter where you go in the UK, most towns and cities will have areas that have a high level of chewing gum spread across pavements and walkways. Not only is unsightly, embarrassing and spreads germs. It costs councils lots of money to sort out. Money that could be used elsewhere i.e. NHS etc.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to start driving lessons.
attributes.background: Lower the legal age to start driving lessons to 16. This will allow teens to start driving and prepare people to start driving once they are 17. A friend of mine started driving lessons at 17 and only got his license at 23 years of age. The struggle is real.

attributes.action: Decision on brexit should need 2nd poll if it involves exit from customs union
attributes.background: The customs union and free trade area were not referred to on the ballot paper in the referendum and could have had an effect on the result if it had been stated on the ballot paper. The UK population should have a final say on all implications if leaving the above is part of the Brexit deal

attributes.action: Ban airlines' seat allocation fees for families
attributes.background: Nowadays marketing is getting mad and air companies are trying to get more monies from people for needless services, where there should a must. Children and families are paying nearly £100 extra to be sure that they will sit together with their children or relatives, husbands, wife on airplanes.
attributes.additional_details:
This fee must be banned for families, as this is extra money on top of the paid charges for holidays, which already cost a lot. 
Air companies are making money from nothing.

attributes.action: No exemption of neutralisation fee for residents - Equal and fair Treatment
attributes.background:
Everyone should be treated equally and fairly. 
If any nation is exempted everyone should be exempted and refunded accordingly. 
It's the policy of state, cannot be a favour.
attributes.additional_details:
Polish national are asking for exemption of Neturalisation fee which I see very unfair to other UK Residence permit holders.

All residents must be weight in same scale. 
Britain ruled most of works alone and can stand strong on its own feet.
Britain is not dependent on any nation.

attributes.action: Give more advice and provide help for free to the parents of obese children.
attributes.background: Children who are obese have higher risks of heart disease and other illnesses so it would be very important to lower the numbers of kids who are in need of help. Providing more help by making their parents aware of this and sending them free leaflets on how to help their child(ren) would be helpful.
attributes.additional_details: The number of obese children would change dramatically and fall if further support was given to parents or careers of children. Obesity levels in the UK are really high compared to other European countries and the world. Meal plans, guidance and leaflets with facts on obesity should be given to parents or careers so they can help their child lose weight and decrease chances of breathing difficulty, high blood pressure or a stroke in the future.

attributes.action: Nobody should be able to contest a Will.
attributes.background: If someone makes a Will when of sound mind then their wishes should be respected. If Wills can be contested then what is the point in paying a solicitor to write one in the first place?

attributes.action: Review the current deportation system, and address its surrounding concerns.
attributes.background: Review gov. process of deportations, particularly through charter flights; address their impact on detainees. Address the impact of deportation centres, especially on children. Address lack of care for legal proceedings and claims before deportations. Address violence and racism on charter flights.
attributes.additional_details:
People subject to the UK deportation system are in a vulnerbale place, and there are many issues which need to be addressed.

I have written an article with references: http://writingco.tumblr.com/post/157272986629/secretive-night-flights-the-uks-un-reviewed 

Most powerful sources: http://www.medicaljustice.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/state-sponsored-cruelty.pdf & http://www.refugeecouncil.org.uk/what_we_do/childrens_services/working_with_age_disputed_children/children_in_detention

attributes.action: Amnesty for illegal immigrants who have avoided detection for 10 years
attributes.background: Amnesty to those who have avoided detection for 10 years would be economically beneficial. These people are unable to contribute to this economy, unable to pay taxes, even though they have been work (cash in hand i.e) and unable to take proper part in society.

attributes.action: PE should not be a core subject in secondary school!
attributes.background: Some students get bullied in PE because they're not good at doing the activities they are told to do e.g running, and some students are not confident enough to do PE. I personally think that PE should not be a core subject, it should be our choice if we want to study this subject or not.
attributes.additional_details: As a GCSE student, I don't think that P.E is going to help us in the future unless we want to become a PE teacher, personal trainer, Athlete etc. Therefore, we should have the right to choose.

attributes.action: Reject Brexit If The UK Fails To Maintain Access To The Single Market
attributes.background: The EU countries make up 53% of  imports and 44% of British exports. Leaving the European Union would put Britains position in the single market in doubt meaning the introduction of tariffs on trade. This would mean an increase in prices of imported products and less foreign investment.
